title: Transfigure [exhibition opening title sequence]
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Interactive media
abstract: Tensions and wonder between technology, nature, identity and image.
description: Contains motion graphics treatment of the word 'Transfigure' in aqua blue on black background. Produced by ACMI Design for the opening/promotional moving image titles for the exhibition of the same name.  'Transfigure' was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 8 December 2003 - 9 May 2004. See Exhibition activity record "Transfigure" (ID 9) for more information The exhibition Transfigure will explore transformations of perception, body, movement, space and landscape to reveal tensions and wonder between technology and nature, identity and image. Moving through ACMI's renowned Screen Gallery, visitors will encounter digital bodies, artificial intelligence, virtual constructions, gameplay scenarios, and startling images that will surprise and transform their experience. Transfigure will feature three internationally acclaimed interactive installations: Osmose and Ephémère*, immersive virtual reality environments by Canadian artist Char Davies; and Prosthetic Head, a computer-generated head that converses with visitors, created by Australian artist Stelarc. Also featuring, from ACMI's Collections, other compelling media artworks by prominent Australian and international artists: Ian Andrews; Drew Berry; Paul Brown; Justine Cooper; Chris Cunningham (with Björk); Gina Czarnecki; Robert Gligorov; selectparks; Soda; Mike Stubbs; Steina Vasulka; Tamás Walizcky; Vikki Wilson. Curated by Alessio Cavallaro.
